intro: Scrophularia grayana, commonly known as the gray mountain beard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many species with medicinal and ornamental value. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Scrophularia grayana is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
